alert.note: Alert for Lawrence; Martin (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 30 at 9:56PM EDT until April 04 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River near Rivervale...down to Shoals. White River at Newberry...down to Hazleton. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... White River at Elliston. .Widespread lowland flooding continues along the East Fork White River from Rivervale to Shoals....and along the White River at Elliston to Hazleton. Moderate flooding is occurring on the White River at Petersburg...and is forecast to start at Hazleton midday Friday. Moderate flooding is expected to end on the White River on Sunday. The crest on the East Fork White River will pass from Williams to Shoals tonight...while the crest on the White River will slowly pass Petersburg late Friday. Minor flooding is expected to end on the East Fork White River early next week...and on the White River at Greene County points tonight...while continuing at Edwardsport and points downriver through at least next week. Rain going into this weekend may extend flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated by noon Friday. && ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Fork White River at Williams. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.2 feet, Extensive river flooding in progress. Several local roads are flooded including SR 450 just east of Williams and Stumphole Bridge Rd. Local residents use Ridge Road to travel from Williams to Bedford at this level and higher. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:35 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 11.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:35 AM EDT Thursday was 11.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Monday afternoon and continue falling to 3.7 feet Sunday, April 09. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
